bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter], November 1, 1916

div1.p: Carter writes about the plans to combat yellow fever in Brazil.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter], November 1, 1916
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
BALTIMORE, MD. Bahia Brazil,
Novem 1/16
My dear Laura:
div1.p:
I think A vessel leaves for New
York on the 2d or 3d. This then will be my
last chance to write to you from this place
Guiteras came this morning. Is
in trouble because - it being All - Saints day-
he can't get his trunk from the Custom
house. He doesn't like the hotel - nor do I for that
matter - & has gone to the Pension Ingleza in which
I was at first - It is better, than the Hotel but I found bed-
bugs there. We leave on the 4 possibly the
morning of the 5; & as I have been here
since the 24 24. I can well wait 3 more
days. I will be glad to get through here: however,
We go from here to Para, & I expect directly
up to Manaos. If we do not stop at Para - or
stop only a very short time - Gorgas will
be able to go to Manaos & yet reach Washing-
ton by Dec 10th It should take 18 days - pos-
sibly 21 days longer to finish up Iqui-
tos - which will be either for Guiteras &
myself - or if G. does not wish to go for me
by myself. I think after if we ought to
go to Ceara & Pernambuco which
wouldt take about 2 weeks more less
than 3 weeks any way.

I keep well & the weather is not but except
in the mornings. It is hot then especially
walking. I am however able to take exercise
in the afternoons. Tell Laura, Jr. that I have been
to market & have been to the ends of the
4 street car - lines of Bahia which has a population of
about 310.000
